results.title: Hollywood Costume: Interview with Jan Chapman and Janet Patterson
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The 2009 film ‘Bright Star’ (directed by Jane Campion)tells the story of the romance between the English poet John Keats (1795 - 1821)and Fanny Brawne.
In this interview, ‘Bright Star’ producer Jan Chapman and costume designer Janet Patterson discuss the creative process behind costume design, and the design choices that went into making one of the costumes for the character Fanny Brawne (played in the film by Abbie Cornish).
The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).
Clips from ‘Bright Star’ (2009) courtesy of Hopscotch Films.

results.title: Omni
results.brief_description:
Finbar is a young man who is obsessed with pi. His fragile existence is thrown into tumult when he discovers a mysterious note in his locker…

Under the category ‘Secondary Live Action’, Blake Whelan, ACT, was the Screen It 2012 winner.

results.title: Ian Burns: in the telling interview
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
New York based Australian artist Ian Burns discusses his inventive ‘meta-cinematic’ exhibition, ‘In the Telling’. Presenting a network of close-circuit kinetic sculptures that work together to create live video footage inside the gallery, the exhibition invites audiences to suspend their disbelief and behold a moment of cinematic cliché and excess.

In this interview, Ian talks about his art process, influences and goes into the ideas behind works included in the exhibition such as the ACMI commissioned ‘Anywhere and Here’.

results.title: Neal Benezra 21st Century Museums: SFMOMA Looking Forward
results.creator_credit: Public Programs - Events (Helen Simondson) and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Neal Benezra, director of San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA), talks about the history of the institution with regards to its upcoming expansion. Benezra tells the story of his journey to find the architects who designed the expansion and explains the thinking behind the vision for the building.

This talk featured as part of the ‘William Kentridge: Five Themes’ exhibition public programs events. The exhibition was originally curated by SFMOMA in 2009 and has since travelled to New York, Paris, Vienna, Jerusalem and Moscow.

results.title: Moon to Dust
results.creator_credit: Kanlaya Padungsin and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: Winner of ‘Best Character Animation’ for RMIT’s AIM Graduate Screenings, 2009. Set to the song of the same name by Georgia Fields, ‘Moon to Dust’ is a beautiful and melancholic rendering of belonging, isolation and change.

results.title: Mark Rosenthal in conversation with William Kentridge
results.brief_description:
Mark Rosenthal, curator of the ‘William Kentridge: Five Themes’ exhibition, joins world renowned artist and filmmaker William Kentridge in conversation days before the official opening of the exhibition. Kentridge talks about becoming an artist in the apartheid era of South Africa, how he developed his art practice and the importance of the studio as a place for safe stupidity.

This is a rare opportunity to hear one of the world’s most renowned moving image artists discuss his remarkable work.

results.title: The Locket
results.brief_description:
It would be easy to discard a worthless, old locket found on the beach but, out of respect for a serviceman in a black and white photo, an old man embarks on a journey to return the memento to its original owner. He travels a long way from his lonely, daily routine and unearths respect for himself and a fallen solider. ‘The Locket’ is a snapshot of a life we don’t know we’re in until something – or someone – snaps you out of it.
Cast Includes: John Murphy, Iris Whitakker, David Jellie, Victoria Upward, Gomer Jones and Nadine Crichton.
Under the category ‘Secondary Live Action’, this independent entry by Blake Borcich, Year 10, was the Screen It 2011 winner.

results.title: In conversation with Julian Rosefeldt
results.brief_description:
ACMI Curator Sarah Tutton speaks to acclaimed contemporary artist Julian Rosefeldt, offering a unique insight into his creative process.

German-born Rosefeldt makes visually opulent film and video installations. Following the exhibition of his 5-channel work ‘American Night’, Julian’s work ‘The Shift’ appeared as part of ACMI’s ‘Star Voyager’ exhibition in 2011. Rather than focussing on the exhibited work, Rosefeldt discusses his previous work, themes and influences, by way of prelude to his current projects.

This conversation provides the rare opportunity to hear one of the world’s most renowned moving image artists discuss his remarkable work.

results.title: In conversation with NASA astronaut Rex Walheim
results.brief_description: To top off a decade-long career at NASA, Rex Walheim was in the final shuttle mission for NASA’s 30 year space program. He provides a detailed account of NASA’s space program and space exploration moving forward, as well as the achievements of the past. He also looks at his own path to becoming an astronaut, the experience of space travel and how to do a space walk.

results.title: The Long road to independence
results.creator_credit: Mohammed Abdur Rahman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Serving in the Australian army in East Timor, Mohammed Abdur Rahman and his fellow soldiers were attacked by the Indonesian army many times and involved in some highly publicized events. Over time, Rahman became quite connected to the nation and its people, performing humanitarian work and witnessing East Timor’s struggle towards independence.
